name: IAM FAQ
title: IAM FAQ
body:
Overview

This article serves as a comprehensive FAQ for Identity and Access Management (IAM), addressing common questions and clarifying key concepts related to authentication, authorization, and identity management.

 

Table of Contents

  • General
  • Tivian Access- Business
  • Tivian Access- Technical
  • Migration
  • Security
  • Integrations
  • Customizations and Configurations
  • Multi-factor Authentication
  • Troubleshooting: As it happens

**Some information might be outdated-- use it as a reference only.

 

General

What is TivianAccess?

Tivian Access is a product of the Tivian portfolio that enables a rich feature-set in the field of Identity Management and Authentication. Part of that are Single Sign On (see Single Sign On (SSO)) multi-factor authentication (see Multi Factor Authentication MFA) and federation (see Federated Authentication (Federation)). It is a SaaS solution that is not tightly coupled to a single Tivian product. Also see https://qbdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IAM for some high level information, Development for technical information and Marketing for information that could be used for sales.

 

What purpose does Tivian Access serve?

Tivian Access deals with Identity Management. It offers an Identity Provider solution for products of the Tivian universe to our clients. Main goal of the Tivian Access project is to enable a single SaaS solution that serves the purpose of authentication and management of identity data. See above for some features that are supported.

 

What is the focused group of clients?

The focused group of clients are companies having their own IdP solution, that are using EFS Admin (with survey and other modules) and Portals.

The focus is also put on cases with managed users. (also see Business Decisions)

 

What client profiles are supported?

Clients that want to leverage the benefits of Tivian Access should fulfill the following set of requirements (also see Business Decisions):

  • Organizations having their own established Identity Provider on cloud

  • Organizations having their on premise infrastructure with ADFS

  • Organizations who doesn’t have Single sign on yet but would like to get on-boarded to Tivian Access

Who is our Identity Provider?

For the current solution we chose Okta as our Identity Provider. The website of Okta could be found here. If there are any questions regarding the Identity Provider decision ask (or possibly or ). For technical documentation regarding the Identity Provider have a look at Okta or ask or .

 

Which applications are supported?

Currently EFS Admin Portals and the Data Voyager are the supported applications.

Essentials can also be used with Tivian Access, but this was only tested once and never used in a production setup.

see Business Decisions

 

Which groups of users are affected?

Only EFS Admin users and Panelists are in scope of the current IAM project status. Therefore only these users are affected by the current solution and only these users will benefit from SSO features. (also see Business Decisions )

 

 

Tivian Access - Business

How is authorization handled / How do users get access to an installation?

Authorization will be handled by the respective applications. 

E.g: For EFS Admin that means that users still have to be added as an admin user in the installation before a user can login via Tivian Access (Okta) and gain access.

How/When can Tivian support employees access installations using Tivian Access ?

Since the Tivian AD will be connected to Okta, every support employee will have the possibility to sign in with Okta.

The access to an installation depends on two factors:

  • Is Tivian Access enabled on the installation (aka: Did the customer buy Tivian Access)

  • Is an admin user present for the support employee (since authorization will still be handled in the application)

If both factors are given, the access to the installation should be granted

 

Changes in ESS

Can I still manage the password for Panelists in EFS?

Yes, adding / editing / resetting password is still possible for panelists, but will only have impact on Panelists using Panelwebsite. Passwords for Admin users and Panelists using Portals are handled within the IdP

 

Is there a self registration for users? (either Portals or EFS Admin)

No, only authentication is handled when enabling Tivian Access. Registration is still handled in the respective apps.

 

Are there existing features in EFS or Portals that change after enabling Tivian Access?

Yes, especially changing the email-addresses of Panelists and EFS Admin users is disabled. But also changing the password of an EFS Admin user in EFS is not necessary anymore. Changing the password of Panelists will only affect Panelwebsite.

 

 

Tivian Access - Technical

Settings on Okta

I need to setup a tenant in Okta, how do I do it ?

Start looking here: Okta tenant setup. This should give you a good starting point for whats steps are required / possible for a tenant setup in Okta.

Where can I find documentation about the Okta account ?

Documentation about the setup of the Okta account: Global Okta Setup
Documentation on how to setup tenants in Okta: Okta tenant setup


The documentation does not cover my problem where can I find more ?

Okta offers a developer documentation here https://developer.okta.com/docs/.
The reference documentation for the APIs also includes Postman collections which can be used to simply make requests against Okta (e.g: Okta API Reference: Users)

In case no documentation helped, contact the Okta Support

I have to create resources in Okta - is there a naming convention?

Yes. You have to strictly follow the naming convention if anything is modified in Okta manually.
See Naming conventions in Okta

 

 

Settings on EFS Admin and Portals

What settings can be configure in EFS ?

The module IdentityAccessManager has to be configured and activated in order to delegate authentication into EFS to Okta. This is the only places for configuration.
The module is added automatically with the 19.5 release to every installation per default.

All settings will be configured by 2nd level support.

How can I configure the module IdentityAccessManager

The module configuration can be found at System > Options > Platform cockpit > System configuration in the EFS Admin UI.
All configuration options can be viewed and changed in the grouped collapsible IdentityAccessManager.

For a detailed description of the configuration options please see Module "IdentityAccessManager"

How can I deactivate the module IdentityAccessManager

If the EFS Admin can be accessed set the configuration value iam_module_active to false (for location see above). This will disable all module functionality.
In case the UI can not be used, the same applies by setting the value directly in the database.

Please note that disabling the module after activation can have side effects.

 

What Browsers and operating systems are supported by Okta?

The most recent browsers are supported as well as IE11.

See https://support.okta.com/help/s/article/Okta-Browser-and-OS-Support-Policy

 

 

Migration

Why is any migration required for Tivian Access ?

In oder for users to sign in to our Identity Provider (Okta), they need to be created in Okta and set a password. In the further document this is also referred to as the user sync.

This step is only required for users which are signing in to Okta directly and not using a federated authentication to their company’s Identity Provider. A list of known domains for user email addresses will be used to decide wether a user needs to be synced or not.

Also to comply with the authentication protocols we are using to enable Single Sign On across the applications it is required to register application instances at Okta. For applications like EFS this is done manually during the setup of Tivian Access but for all existing portal instances this needs to be done once.

To conclude, the following migrations are required:

  • Sync EFS Admin users to Okta → EFS Admin users will be able to login with Okta

  • Sync Panelists to Okta → Portal users will be able to login with Okta

  • Sync of existing Portal instances to Okta → Portal instances can be used with Tivian Access

Who does the migrations ?

Migration will be performed by 2nd level support. All necessary resources to enable 2nd level support will be delivered bythe IAM-Team.The exact process is not finalised yet.

Why do I need to sync portals to Okta ?

OpenID Connect requires applications to be registered at the Identity Provider to achieve a login for this application. This mechanism is done to avoid attacks like Man-In-The-Middle attacks and to ensure maximal security.

New portals, which are created when Tivian Access is active, will be automatically synced to Okta. For existing portals this has to be done once when setting up Tivian Access for an EFS installation.

When should I do the portal sync ?

The portal sync is completely independent of the running business on the EFS installation (and its users). The sync should happen before activating Tivian Access to ensure that all portal installation will work and be accessible.

The sync will take only a few seconds so it can be done shortly before, but we recommend to leave a time buffer in case the sync will not be successful.

What steps are required for the user sync ?

The user sync consists of two phases.
Phase 1 is creating the users in Okta. A script will take all existing users from an EFS installation (EFS Admins or Panelists) and push them via API calls to Okta.

Phase 2 is activating the users in Okta. A script will activate the previously created users via API. This will trigger Okta to send out an activation mail to the users. Once the users will follow the instructions in the email, they will be able to setup a new password in Okta so they can log in.

Phase 1 should be done before activating Tivian Access on an installation, since it can be very time consuming. Phase 2 should happen either shortly before activating Tivian Access or right after. Without the activation, users will not be able to login to the EFS installation but if they are activated to early, users will most likely be confused by the mail from Okta because they can not login to any application after setting up their account.

Communication with the client will be they key, since they user experience with the sync is highly dependant on the client setup within Tivian

How long does a user migration take ?

This depends highly on the amount of users in the installation(s) and if they are using their company’s Identity Provider (since those users don’t need to be synced).

Syncing a few (<100) EFS Admin users should not take more than a few seconds.

If a million panelist users needs to be synced, this could possibly take hours.

The limiting factor to this will be the Okta API rate limit which is set to 600 user creations a minute (shared across all Okta applications)

When should I start the user migration ?

To answer this you have to think about the following:

  • During migration users receive an activation mail from Okta. Do the users expect such an email ? When can they start using their Okta account (Tivian Access is completely activated on the EFS installation)

  • Activating Tivian Access without the user sync (and assuming no Identity Provider is used for federation) will have the effect that users can not sign in to EFS anymore.

To conclude: Migration has to happen before the activation of Tivian Access (for all users which are not using their company’s Identity Provider). If it happens too early, it will cause a potential bad user experience.

 

 

Security

What security standard is used for authenticating a user and for communication with our Identity Provider?

For communication (and hence for authentication of a user) with our IdP the OpenID Connect standard is used. A detailed explanation can be found here:

https://openid.net/connect/

The current solution uses the implicit flow (portals) and the code flow (EFS Admin) - see Flows

 

Where is Identity Data stored?

Identity Data is stored at Okta. Okta is using AWS cloud services to host its identity solution. 

Okta offers an EU cell for European companies. Data will be stored in Europe (information from Okta is that data is stored in Germany and Ireland) - also see https://www.okta.com/press-room/press-releases/okta-cements-its-commitment-to-emea-market-announces-eu-data-centre/

Okta will store first name, last name and email address as well as possibly password and MFA details like a phone number of a user (this might change in future).

Identity data is still stored in the respective applications like EFS and Portals.

 

How is security handled by Okta (our Identity Provider)?

Okta provides documentation about security related topics and certifications.

see https://www.okta.com/security/

 

How is data transfer between the EFS installation (EFS-Admin, Portals) and our Identity Provider secured?

Data transferred from EFS to our Identity Provider will take place using the HTTPS protocol. An API token mechanism will be used to authorize requests to our Identity Provider.

Data transfer from our Identity Provider will also be secured using the HTTPS protocol. Communication in that direction will take place in the boundaries of OpenID Connect.

 

How is data transfer between our Identity Provider and the client’s Identity Provider secured?

In the case of the communication with a client’s Identity Provider both sides have to technically take care of securing the communication. Our Identity Provider offers communication via HTTPS. During setup of the client’s Identity Provider we have to take care, that the communication fits our security needs.

 

Is the Identity Provider always available?

Our Identity Provider guarantees availability of 99.9%. The documentation can be found here.

https://www.okta.com/a-secure-reliable-service-you-can-trust/

 

What are the session (and token) lifetimes?

The session times can be found in the section sessions - see Sessions

A more detailed explanation of the difference between the sessions can be found in Sessions Explained

 

I previously used the high security mode in EFS - can I use that feature with IAM SSO?

The High security mode focuses on password policies, retry and lock processes and multi-factor authentication as well as ACLs, sessions and cookies.

Especially password-policies, multi-factor authentication, sessions and retry/lock processes do not effect the solution anymore when SSO is active. Hence most of the features in high-security mode might be irrelevant.

also see MFA (Multi-Factor-Authentication) and Password Policy

 

How will a password reset happen?

see: Tivian Access with EFS and Portals

 

Are there rules for password strength and password retention policy?

see: Tivian Access with EFS and Portals

 

If a user logs in at our Identity Provider, will the user be able to login every Tivian application?

No. There is a difference between the authentication (who am I?) and the authorization/access (what am I allowed to do?) in the current solution. The Identity Provider will only verify that an identity belongs to the respective user. The access right for that specific user are still managed by every Application.

Hence every user that logs in at our Identity Provider can tell every Tivian application their respective identity but will not be able to access every application.

 

If we connect our solution to the customer's Identity Povider, how will security take place at this Identity Provider?

The customer’s Identity Provider belongs to the customer. Therefore we do not have (and we should never have) any access to that provider changing anything. Security on the side of the Identity Provider is fully Managed by the customer.

 

How will I be able to manage access to applications in our Identity Provider?

The Identity Provider will not manage any access policies for now. It will only verify a user’s identity.

 

My users got an e-mail to activate their account and to set a passwort from Okta but they use their own Identity Provider - What password is correct?

The password the user provided at Okta will be stored at Okta. The user should never be asked for that password if this user is an Identity Provider user. But in that case either the configuration in EFS or Okta are not correct.

see Okta tenant setup and SAML Provider Setup

 

My EFS installation is currently using HTTP (without HTTPS) - is it possible to enable Tivian Access in that case?

Using HTTP is not secure. Therefore it is prohibited use Tivian Access with HTTP. There are no guarantees in such a careless use case.

Before using Tivian Access HTTPS has to be enabled for every product making use of Tivian Access.

 

With Chrome in version 80+ third-party cookies without the same-site attribute are not allowed anymore - is that an issue? I can see warnings in Chrome’s developer console for the Okta login flow - does that effect functionality?

Okta has taken care to update all relevant Cookies. The warnings in Chrome’s developer console stem from Cookies that are not affected. They are not sent to the server and therefore not critical.

We hope that Okta will update their libraries to get rid of the warning. But no functionality should be affected.

Also see:

https://devforum.okta.com/t/errors-in-chrome-with-samesite-using-okta-auth-js/7373/5

https://developer.okta.com/docs/release-notes/2019-10-0/#tokens-transform-events-no-longer-available

https://blog.chromium.org/2019/10/developers-get-ready-for-new.html

 

 

Integrations

What is an Identity Provider ?

An Identity Provider is a service which is used to handle authentication for other services. The authentication process is specified by protocols.
It is commonly used to achieve Single-Sign-On (SSO) across multiple applications.

A few common ones are:

  • https://www.okta.com/

  • https://auth0.com/

  • Social Identity Providers (Facebook, Twitter, Google)

How do we integrate with Identity Providers ?

We integrate with customer’s Identity Providers using standardised protocols. 

Also Okta offers documentation on integration with external Identity Providers

For a more detailed description please have a look at OpenID Connect or SAML 2.0 on how they do authentication for apps. This applies because our Identity Provider is an application from the customer’s perspective.

Which Identity Providers are supported?

We support Identity Providers which support authentication via the protocol SAML 2.0 or OpenID Connect. They also have to be publicly available (not in a private network).
It does not matter if it is a cloud hosted service or an on-premise solution. Due to the fact that every piece of software implements a protocol slightly different, each Identity Provider has to be tested so that we can guarantee that it works.

Is the Identity Provider “X” supported ?

These are the providers which have been tested and where the setup is known.

Please have a look at the List of tested Identity Providers.

What to do if the Identity Provider is not tested yet ?

Not tested does not mean not working. Please contact 2nd level support or the IAM team to find out if an integration is possible or not.

How is an Identity Provider tested ?

Identity Providers are tested by testing out the login to Okta via the Identity Provider. Testing an Identity Provider does not require Tivian Access to be activated in EFS. The integration can be tested only with Okta and does not impact any business.
Please note: In order to successfully test an Identity Provider, Tivian needs at least access to a test user present in the Identity Provider.

How long does it take to setup an Identity Provider ?

This depends on the case. In case all information is provided by the customer it could only take a few minutes. In case some information is missing or the integration is not working some interaction is required with the customer (which may take some time depending on how the communication is handled).

Do you support Social Identity Providers ?

As part of the 19.5 EFS Winter release, we do not support social Identity Providers.

A client of mine offers SAML and OpenID Connect at their Identity Provider - what should I choose?

OpenID Connect is the preferred standard but SAML is also possible. If both are offered choose OpenID Connect.

Can I set up multiple Identity Providers for a client at the same time ?

Yes, multiple Identity Providers can be configured in Okta. The identity provider where the user has to authenticate is chosen based on the email address (domain) the user provided.

E.g: user@red-soda.com → Authenticates at the US Employee Identity Provider from the red soda company

user@red-soda.de → Authenticates at the DE Employee Identity Provider from the red soda company

My current installation has an Identity Provider (IdP) enabled and the IdP ID is set. Thus I am not able to login to the clients IdP - How can I login to that installation?

The IdP ID directly redirect the a user to the respective Identity Provider. But you can create a request on your own to navigate to Okta without the IdP ID. The easiest way to achieve that is by looking at the network traffic in your browser (see https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-devtools/network).

There will be a request to access.questback.com ending with /authorize in the path part of the URL. Just copy that request and remove the idp_id from the search parameters. This will bring you to the Okta without the IdP ID. Then you can login as normal by providing your email address.

Another way is to navigate to https://access.questback.com and login there. After successfull login get navigate to the installation of choice. You should be logged in immediately (for portals you will have to click sign-in)

 

 

Customizations and Configurations

What happens to customizations regarding the login experience for users in Portals?

The login experience is delivered by our Identity Provider (Okta). Therefore customization regarding the login itself will not be shown anymore. In the first phase of the project (Winter release) custom login screens are not yet supported. Pages like the public-home screen still stay active. They will now contain a login button instead of the login form. The login button is customizable and will lead to the Okta login.

 

What happens to customizations regarding the login experience for users in EFS?

The login experience is delivered by our Identity Provider (Okta). Therefore recent customizations especially regarding the login screen will not be shown anymore.

 

How will I be able to customize the login page?

Currently there are no tenant specific customizations in place. This might be delivered in a later release.

 

How can I configure custom session settings ?

Sessions settings might be adapted if a client has specific needs for session times.

See Sessions for more information

 

How can I configure the password strength?

The password strength is configured in Okta. It is not configured per application as before but per group of users. As with single-sign-on capabilities a configuration per application is not sufficient anymore.

A sane default will be implemented for every of our customer’s. If there is the need to further enhance password strength and a customer asks for that, the password policies for that client could be adapted.

Especially password complexity, password age and lock-mechanisms can be configured.

 

How can the emails from Okta be customized ?

Unfortunately we do not offer an email customization option right now.

All Emails will be sent out using the currently configured style in Okta.

 

Can I configure the sender of the Okta emails for a customer?

No. Email from Okta are send out using the sender <noreply@okta.com>

 

Can I configure password policies only for specific users?

Yes, that is possible, but if there are a lot of different rules it will be hard to manage users.

 

What characters are allowed when creating users?

For email addresses only characters specified in RFC 3696 Section 3 are supported.

For first and last name 4-byte characters are not supported.

For more details see: https://help.okta.com/en/prod/Content/Topics/Directory/Reference_Directories.htm

 

I try to configure Okta but I am not able to see the Okta admin view. I just see a welcome page. How can I login to the Okta admin console?

Customers should not see Okta in any case. That is why this welcome page exists.

For Tivian internal users a deeplink can be used to access the admin area - e.g.

https://questback-admin.okta.com/admin/dashboard

 

 

Multi-factor Authentication

What is Multi-factor Authentication?

Multi factor Authentication means that a user that wants to authenticate has to provide other factors apart from username and password to verify their identity.

What factors are supported ?

We currently offer the following factors from Okta.

Officially supported:

  • Okta Verify

  • Google Authenticator

  • SMS (clarify legal questions first! technical support is in place)

Also tested:

  • Microsoft Authenticator

 

Is MFA enabled by default?

No. It has to be requested during the order of Tivian Access.

Can users use other Authenticator apps ?

Even though they are not officially supported we tested it and had not problems using the Microsoft Authenticator app instead of the Google Authenticator.

In general it seems that authenticator apps supporting TOTP (Time-Based One-Time Passwords) are working fine and are exchangeable.

We still recommend the usage of the officially supported Google Authenticator.

As soon as we know of other authenticators which are working with Okta, we will document them in the list above (like the Microsoft Authenticator)

When does a user have to provide MFA?

The default behavior is that a user has to provide the second factor each time he/she logs in. This includes an option that the second factor of a user is remembered by Okta and does not need to be provided again for a fixed time. More configuration could be provided.

 

How long will the second factor be remembered by our Identity Provider?

This can be configured in our Identity Provider. The default is shown on Sessions.

For customization regarding MFA session times have a look at Customizations and Configurations part.

 

Do I have any additional charges when using MFA ?

No, all MFA usage is included in the fee paid for Tivian Access as per the 2020 rollout package.

How can a user reset MFA ?

In case you lost your mobile phone and are not able to receive SMS or did loose the configured authenticator app, only an administrator can reset it for you in Okta.

 

How will MFA be configured in case the customer’s Identity Provider already supports MFA?

In case the customer’s Identity Provider already offers MFA and it is already in use, there is no need to add additional MFA capabilities from our Identity Provider (Okta).

If MFA is configured at the customer’s Identity Provider and Okta the customer’s users have to provide MFA two times. If that is the desired behavior it could be configured - but user experience might be questionable.

If a customer is already using MFA we should not force our MFA solution replacing the customer’s solution. It is best if the customer is already using MFA and does not need to use our Okta MFA services.

 

 

Troubleshooting: As it happens

It seems the current Okta login page does not work corretly - how can I login to fix that issue?

This should never happen on any production environment.

There is a bypass login that might help with the current issue - it can be found when adding “/login/default” to the base URL of the current Okta account (e.g. “https://okta.testback.com/login/default“)
